Name: Gracemount
More Information:
The development is part of the City of Edinburgh Council 21st Century Homes programme.
https://www.edinburgh.gov.uk/info/209/regeneration_and_town_centre_management/969/21st_century_homes_for_edinburgh/2
Project details:
Phase 1: Building 67 homes for social rent, 20 homes for midmarket rent and 12 homes for sale under a shared equity scheme. 
Phase 2: Building 70 flats and 46 houses for sale, including sale under a shared equity scheme.
Number of homes: 215 homes in total.
Project timescales:
Work started on site in November 2010 and is Phase completed in July 2012. 
Phase 2- Evolution is currently on site with homes being built over the next two years.

Name: Birchwood Terrace
More Information:
Information on midmarket homes can be found at
http://www.malcolm-homes.org.uk/default.asp?ID=248
Project details: 23 homes for social rent and 39 for midmarket rent.
Number of homes: 58 flats and 4 terrace houses.
Project timescales: Work began on site in June 2011 and completed in May 2012.

Name: Boswall Parkway
Project details: 15 homes for social rent
Number of homes: 2 x 1 bedroom (2 person),10 x 2 Bedroom and 3 x 3 bedrooms
Project timescales: Work began on site in October 2010 and  completed in December 2011.

Name: Brunstane Apartments, Tait Wynd
Project details:
A mix of one and two bedroom apartments all finished to an extremely high standard. 
Springfield properties won apartment of the year at the Scottish Homes award 2012 for Brunstane Court - a project that the Council supported with a rental guarantee.
Number of homes: 18 homes for mid market rent
Project timescales: Homes started on site in March 2010 and completed in Spring 2012

Name: Bughtlin Market
Project details: 18 homes for social rent
Number of homes: Part of a larger development within East Craigs
Project timescales: Work began on site in October 2010 and  completed in September 2011.

Name: Burdiehouse Terrace
Project details: 15 homes for social rent and 13 for mid markets rent, including 3 flats for wheelchair users.
Number of homes: 28 homes for social rent and for mid markets rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in May 2012 and is due for completion in October 2013.

Name: Cityscape
More Information:
The homes are now available to see online

http://www.cityscapeedinburgh.co.uk/
Project details:
These homes will be delivered through Phase 1 of the National Housing Trust which the City of Edinburgh Council, works in partnership with developers, the Scottish Futures Trust (SFT) and the Scottish Government to deliver affordable housing.
The development will comprise 126 flats with a mix of one, two and three bedrooms homes.
Number of homes: 126 flats for mid market rent
Project timescales: Work started on site in October 2011 and completed in May 2013

Name: Clerwood Terrace
Project details: 44 homes social rent, mid market rent and shared ownership
Number of homes: 44, two bedroom flats
Project timescales: Work began on site in February 2010 and completed in December 2010

Name: Dinmont Drive
Project details: There will be 16 flats built on site provide a mix of one and two bedroom homes.
Number of homes: 16 homes for midmarket rent
Project timescales: The homes is currently on site and completed in October 2012

Name: Moreland View, (former SASA site)
Project details:
The project will deliver a mixed tenure development of  42 affordable homes.

http://keytochoice.scotsman.com/NewDev_Moreland_View.cfm
Number of homes: 24 homes for social rent and 18 homes for mid market
Project timescales: Work started on site in July 2011 and  completed in March 2013

Name: Elizabeth Maginnis Court/Royston Wardieburn
Project details: 68 care homes and alongside community and day care facilities at Royston Wardieburn by Dunedin Canmore Housing Association.  These homes will be available to older people with high support needs who may otherwise need to be accommodated in residential care.
Number of homes: 68 new affordable fully accessible homes.
Project timescales: Work began in September 2009 and completed in June 2011.

Name: Former BT site Murihouse Phase 1
Project details: 202 affordable homes will be built in total, with 58 in Phase 1. The homes will be built to the Greener Homes Standard which means that homes willl have low heating costs and produce less carbon emissions.
Number of homes: 24 homes for midmarket rent and 34 for social rent.
Project timescales: Work began on site in April 2013 and phase 1 will complete in March 2014.

Name: Forth Quarter Plot 19
Project details: 136 homes for social rent, midmarket rent and shared ownership. The flats are generously proportioned with balconies or feature bay windows to most apartments while those on the ground floor feature private terraces.
Number of homes: 71 homes for rent, 23 for midmarket rent and 42 for low cost ownership
Project timescales:
Work began on site for 91 homes in  April 2010 and completed in December 2011.
Work started in June 2012 on an additional 22 homes for social rent and 23 for mid market rent which will be completed by February 2013

Name: Link6
Project details: The 98 homes, ranging from one-bedroom through to four-bedroom main-door duplex apartments. Features will include secure underground parking and a central landscaped courtyard. Solar thermal panels will be on the roof providing hot water for a number of properties
Number of homes: 60 homes for social rent and 40 for low cost ownership.
Project timescales: Work started on site in Janury 2011 and completed in March 2013.

Name: Great Junction Street
Project details: The development will consist of three, four and five storey high modern buildings incorporating commercial/retail units on the ground floor.
Number of homes: 20 homes for social rent and 12 for midmarket rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in May 2012 and is due for completion in March 2014

Name: Greendykes A
Project details:
12 homes for mid market rent and 22 for shared ownership.
The mid market home will be managed by Lothain Homes and the shared ownership homes will be managed by Castle Rock Edinvar.
Details on shared ownership homes 
http://keytochoice.scotsman.com/Shared_Greendykes.cfm
Number of homes: 34 affordable homes
Project timescales: Work began on site in November 2010 and  completed in April 2012.

Name: Greendykes C
Project details: A mix of modern houses and flats designed to be energy efficient and affordable to heat. 46 properties will be for midmarket rent and 14 will be allocated for social housing.
Number of homes: 60 midmarket and social rent homes
Project timescales: Work began in April 2013 and will be complete by Spring 2014

Name: Horizon Lochend, Phase 2
Project details: There will be 48 affordable homes built on site with a mix of one, two and three bedroom homes.
Number of homes: 30 homes for social rent and 18 for midmarket rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in July 2013 and will complete by February 2015.

Name: Hyvots Phase 5
Project details:
42 homes for social rent and 18 for low cost ownership
Details on Low cost ownership homes
http://keytochoice.scotsman.com/burndale_place.cfm
Number of homes: Part of a large regeneration development in Moredun/Hyvots area.
Project timescales: Work began in November 2010 and completed in June 2012

Name: Hyvots Phase 6
More Information:
Part of the Morden Hyvots Regeneration

http://www.dunedincanmore.org.uk/group/default.asp?ID=259
Project details: 32 of the homes will be flats and 10 will be houses.
Number of homes: 42 Homes for social rent
Project timescales: Work began in April 2012 and completed in  May 2013.

Name: King's Place, Wauchope Square
Project details:
58 new build houses and flats for rent and shared ownership
Details for shared ownership homes available at 
http://linkhousing.org.uk/our-services/find-a-property/buy-a-home-from-us/shared-ownership-homes-available-at-kings-place-edinburgh/
Number of homes: 31 homes to rent, 15 Shared Ownership, 12 New Supply Shared Equity
Project timescales: Work began on site in  October 2010 and completed in September 2012.

Name: Kirkliston Phase 1
Project details: Phase 1 of a larger development in Kirkliston to be built over the next few years. The homes will be a mix of flats, cottages and houses.
Number of homes: 81 affordables homes for rent and midmarket
Project timescales: Work began on site in February 2012 and is due for completion in November 2013.

Name: Kirkliston Phase 2
Project details: The affordable homes, a mix of 2 and 3 bedroom houses, cottage apartments and apartments. All properties are designed to be built to the latest building and energy efficiency standards including renewable energy in the form of photo voltaic roof tiles.
Number of homes: 81 homes in total with 39 social rent and 42 mid market rent.
Project timescales: Work began in May 2013 and is due to complete in October 2014

Name: Lanark Road West
Project details: 32 homes for rent specifically designed for wheelchair users.
Number of homes: 32 homes for social rent
Project timescales: Construction started on site in October 2011 and completed in June 2013

Name: Leith Fort
Project details: The redevelopment of Fort House is a joint project between Port of Leith and City of Edinburgh Council which will see construction of 102 new homes. 65 of these homes will be provided through Port of Leith HA. 10 of the homes will be houses while the remaining 55 will be flats.
Number of homes: 65 for mid market rent
Project timescales: Work began on site with the demolition of the old council blocks in June and will be completed by February 2015.

Name: Lighthouse Court
More Information:
The homes are now available to see online

http://www.lighthousecourt.co.uk/
Project details:
These homes will be delivered through Phase 1 of the National Housing Trust which the City of Edinburgh Council,  works in partnership with developers, the Scottish Futures Trust (SFT) and the Scottish Government to deliver affordable housing.

The development will comprise 62 low energy homes in a mix of townhouses, maisonettes and flats.
Number of homes: 62 homes for mid market rent
Project timescales: Work started on site in October 2011 and completed in May 2013.

Name: Western Harbour S2, Lindsay Road
Project details: In total there will be 111 properties within this development (including 10 designed for tenants with special needs).
Number of homes: 58 homes for social rent and 53 for midmarket rent
Project timescales: Work started on site in July 2011 and is due for completion in August 2013

Name: Little Road
Project details: 32 flats will be built on site and will provide homes for older people. The homes will be a mixture of one and two bedrooms flats.
Number of homes: 32 homes, 16 for social rent and 16 for mid market rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in January and is due to complete in June 2014

Name: Lower London Road
Project details: 36 homes for rent, with 4 homes for wheeelchairs users.
Number of homes: a mix of 1,2 and 3 bedroom flats including 2 for those with disability/mobility difficulties.
Project timescales: Work began in June 2010 and completed in November 2011.

Name: Magdalene Drive
Project details: All of the houses will have their own private gardens and parking spaces are available on site. Two of the flats will be wheelchair accessible
Number of homes: 23 homes for social rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in September 2012 and due to complete by November 2013.

Name: Newhaven Road Phase 1
Project details: Part of a larger development at City Haven in Leith that will deliver 31 affordable homes in total.
Number of homes: 8 homes for Social Rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in March 2013 and will complete in December 2013

Name: Niddrie House Park
Project details: 22 homes for social rent will be built with a mix of flats and houses. There will also be 6 houses for midmarket rent.
Number of homes: 28 homes for social rent and midmarket rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in September 2012 and due to complete by October 2013.

Name: North Varcity
Project details: These homes will be delivered through Phase 1 of the National Housing Trust which the City of Edinburgh Council, works in partnership with developers, the Scottish Futures Trust (SFT) and the Scottish Government to deliver affordable housing
Number of homes: 89 homes for mid market rent
Project timescales: Work started on site in October 2011 and is  completed in July 2013.

Name: Oxgangs 3B
Project details: Phase 3 of the regeneration of the Oxgangs area which began in 2003. There will be a mix of houses and flats on site including 5 which have been designed to accommodate the needs of  older people.
Number of homes: 34 homes for social rent and midmarket rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in June 2012 and is due to complete in October 2013

Name: Quartermile
More Information:
Midmarket rent homes are now available 

http://www.hillcrest.org.uk/Northern+Housing/Mid+Market+Rent/#/Northern+Housing/Mid+Market+Rent/2092/Q10+Quartermile+Edinburgh/
Project details: A range of affordable housing accommodation which includes wheelchair accessible and elderly amenity flats. There will also be larger sized family homes with dedicated terraced spaces which will benefit from magnificent views including Edinburgh Castle and the Meadows.
Number of homes: 174 homes wiith 98 for affordable rent and 76 mid-market
Project timescales: work began on site in February 2011 and will complete by August 2013

Name: Salamander Place
Project details:
These homes will be delivered through Phase 1 of the National Housing Trust which the City of Edinburgh Council, works in partnership with developers, the Scottish Futures Trust (SFT) and the Scottish Government to deliver affordable housing.

The homes will be developed jointly by Hillcrest Housing Association, Hart Builders & Teague Ltd
Number of homes: 145 homes for mid market rent
Project timescales: Work started on site in May 2012 and due to complete in Spring 2014

Name: St Nicholas School
Project details: 109 affordable units with a mix of social, mid and shared ownership accommodation. This will include 9 wheelchair adapted units and 12 amenity units specifically for the elderly.
Number of homes: 40 homes for social rent, 31 for Shared ownership and 38 for mid market rent
Project timescales: Work began in November 2010  and completed in January 2013

Name: Craigmillar Primary School
Project details: The Primary is located next to the former site of Craigmillar Primary School. There are 83 townhouses and apartments for rent and shared ownership.
Number of homes: 38 for rent and 45 for shared ownership
Project timescales: Work began on site in August 2009 and completed in April 2011.

Name: Hyvots Phase 4
Project details:
58 homes rent
The development won the Scottish Homes Environmental Excellence Award 2012 and was also a finalist for the Sustainable Housing Awards 2011 in the largest social housing project category.
Number of homes: 58 homes are for supported housing and are all suitable for wheelchairs users.
Project timescales: Work began in October 2009 and all 58 units was completed in April  2011.

Name: The Quayside
Project details: 60 homes for social rent and shared ownership
Number of homes: 44 homes for rent.          16 one and two-bedroom  Shared ownership homes
Project timescales: Work began on site in July 2010 and the  development completed  in March 2012.

Name: Wauchope  2b Phase 1
Project details: A total of 45 homes will be built in Phase 1 with 14 homes for shared equity funded with a grant from the City of Edinburgh Council Affordable Housing Supply Programme. 20 homes for midmarket rent will also be funded through the Scottish Government Innovation Fund.
Number of homes: 14 homes for shared ownership and 20 for midmarket rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in May 2012 and is due to complete in August 2013.

Name: West Granton Road
Project details:
The development contains 17 flats (including 2 flats designed for tenants with special needs), made up as follows:

• 4 x 1 bedroom (2 person)
• 13 x 2 bedroom (3 person
Number of homes: 17 homes for Social Rent
Project timescales: Project started on site in January 2010 and completed in May 2011.

Name: West Pilton Crescent
Project details: The homes are the first stage of a wider masterplan for Pennywell and Muirhouse which could lead to 700 homes being delivered over the next few years.
Number of homes: 34 homes for social rent.
Project timescales: Planning permission for 34 homes was granted in April 2013 and work began on site in July 2013.

Name: West Gait
Project details: This affordable housing development will deliver 15 homes for social rent, 30 homes for mid market rent, 28 shared equity homes and 20 homes for shared ownership.
Number of homes: 93 affordable homes for rent and low cost ownership
Project timescales: Work began on site in July 2012 and due to complete in October 2013

Name: Westfield
Project details:
193 homes for social rent, midmarket rent and shared ownership
This development won the 2012 Scottish Homes Award for the Large Affordable Housing Development of the Year.
In September 2012, the development was awarded the 2012 Saltire Award for Large Scale Housing Development of the year.
Number of homes: 58 x 1 person studio flats                                              97 x 1 bed 2 persons flats                            38 x 2 bed 3 person flats
Project timescales: Work began on site in September 2009 and completed in February 2012.

Name: Windsor Place
Project details:
The building will be environmentally friendly, highly insulated and will have Photovoltaic Panels on the roof providing electricity for the common area.
There will be 10 one-bedroom and 13 two-bedroom flats.
Number of homes: 23 homes for social rent
Project timescales: Work began on site in July 2012 and is due for completion in October 2013
